diff_hunk:
@@ -66,23 +66,22 @@ build:gdr --define=with_gdr_support=true
 build:ngraph --define=with_ngraph_support=true
 build:verbs --define=with_verbs_support=true
 
+
 build --define=use_fast_cpp_protos=true
 build --define=allow_oversize_protos=true
 build --define=grpc_no_ares=true
 
-build --spawn_strategy=standalone
-build --genrule_strategy=standalone
-build -c opt
+
+#build --spawn_strategy=standalone
body: having -c opt forces bazel to do opt builds preventing users from having debug builds. Users need to edit .bazelrc to be able to debug. AFAIK default of bazel is fastbuild which is pretty close to opt. --spawn_strategy default is sandboxed where it can and standalone if sandboxing doesn't work. is there a strong reason against sandboxing? AFAIK this was default before this file was added.
